availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Rogers (Caldwell co., ky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy B. Woosley Rogers in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on September 19, 1846. Father of Elizabeth J. Rogers, Melissa Ann Rogers, Frances Rogers, Louisa Rogers, Nancy Rogers, Augustus Rogers, and John Rogers. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 360A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 159.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 262.
"William Thomas "Will" Rogers (1822-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #104677222, accessed July 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/104677222.
